utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Everyone is there. Monica is watching stock prices on a business channel.]

utterances.transcript: Hey Monica, why are we watchin' the business channel?

'Cause I was going by it the other day and I saw that there was a stock with my initials, MEG, on it and, well, sometimes I have to watch for two or three hours before it comes up again but when it does, it's pretty exciting.
Ok honey, you really need a job.
Mon, speaking of which, dad says he knows someone you can call for an interview.
Really.
Ok, right there. That, that's the third sign today. Right there.
On behalf of everyone, I'd just like to say behuh.
No, 'cause you just said dad and everywhere I go today I keep getting signs telling me to go see my father. Like when I was walking over here and I passed a buffet...which is my father's last name.
Ahh.
And they were serving franks which is his first name minus the s at the end. And there was a rotisserie with spinning chicken.
His indian name?
No because I chickened out the last time when I tried to meet him. So I mean coincidences? I don't think so.
Freakish.
Wow.
Freaky.
Weird, weird.
Ok, so uh, who wants the last hamburger?
Oh, alright, that's it, now I have to go see him.
Why?
Hamburger. McDonald's. Old MacDonald had a farm, my dad is a pharmacist.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Central Perk. Chandler and Ross enter in sweats carrying rackets.]

utterances.transcript: Man, I am so beat.
Oh yeah.
Hey, you just wanna forget about raquetball and hang out here?
Yeah alright.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah alright. [they sit at the couch]

utterances.transcript: Hey you're in our seats.
utterances.transcript_with_note: [walks back from the counter] Hey you're in our seats.

utterances.transcript: Oh, sorry we didn't know.
Hey, we were sitting there.
utterances.transcript_with_note: [walks back from the counter] Hey, we were sitting there.

utterances.transcript: Ok, there is one more way to say it, who knows it?
Is that supposed to be funny?
No actually, I was just going for colorful.
What's with this guy?
What's with you?
Uh, nothing, nothing's with him. Enjoy your coffee.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Uh, nothing, nothing's with him. Enjoy your coffee. [as they're walking off, little bully grabs Chandlers hat from behind and puts it on himself]

utterances.transcript: What just happened?
I just took your hat. See, I can be funny too. My, my joke is that I, I took your hat.
That, that is funny. Can I have it back?
No.
No?
No.
Ok, ok, you know what? I think you're very funny. Kudos on that hat joke. But, come on guy just, just give him back the hat.
Why should we?
Because it's a special hat. See he bought it 'cause he was feeling really down one day so he got the hat to cheer himself up, ya know. Now Chandler...
utterances.transcript_with_note: Because it's a special hat. [Chandler looks at Ross funny] See he bought it 'cause he was feeling really down one day so he got the hat to cheer himself up, ya know. Now Chandler...

utterances.transcript: Stop talking, stop talking now. Let me just get this straight. You're actually stealing my hat?
You got a problem with that?
No, just wanna make sure we're on the same page.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Joey and Rachel are sitting there and Monica walks in.]

utterances.transcript: Hey, how'd the interview go?

It bit. It was a 50's theme restraunt. I have to cook in a costume and dance on the counter. I mean I was a chef at Cafe des Artistes. I mean how could I take a job where I have to make something called Laverne and Curly Fries?
So don't do it.
How can I not do it? I have $127 in the bank.
Monica, relax, go get a beer.
I don't want a beer.
Who said it was for you?
Hhhiiii.
utterances.transcript_with_note: [both enter looking down] Hhhiiii.

utterances.transcript: What's the matter with you?
The mean guys at the coffee house took my hat.
Noo.
You're kiddin'.
It was ridiculous. Ya know, these guys, they were bullies, actual bullies, ya know. We're grown ups, this kinda stuff isn't supposed to happen anymore.
Oohhh.
Hi.
Hi.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Hi. [Ross turns to Rachel and they hug]

utterances.transcript: Ohhh Oh no, wait a minute, I have no one.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Ohhh [turns as if to hug someone] Oh no, wait a minute, I have no one.

utterances.transcript: Hey, woah, let's go down there and get your hat back.
Na, forget it, it's probably stripped and sold for parts by now.
Hey, I went up.
utterances.transcript_with_note: [seeing TV] Hey, I went up.

utterances.transcript: What?
My stock, MEG, it went up 2 points. Hey guys, do you realize that if I had invested my $127 in myself yesterday that I'd like have...a lot more than that today. Ya know what, I'm gonna do it.
Do what?
Put all my money in me.
Monica, what are you talking about? You don't know the first thing about the stock market.
What's to know? Buy sell, high low, bears bulls... Yes Manhattan...yeah telephone number of the stock...selling store.
utterances.transcript_with_note: What's to know? Buy sell, high low, bears bulls...[on the phone] Yes Manhattan...yeah telephone number of the stock...selling store.

utterances.transcript: See, didn't I tell ya these pillows would be a good idea?

We love you, we're here for you.
Yeah good luck, good luck.
Thanks.

utterances.transcript: Hey Rach, you uh, you want some sandwich?

Ok, here, I know what we can do.

utterances.transcript: Hey, hey, hey no.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Central Perk. Chandler and Ross are sitting at the couch.]

utterances.transcript: Hey.
What?
Do you have to be a Century 21 real-estate agent to get to wear those really cool jackets?
Do you say this stuff to girls?
Hehehehey, isn't that the guy who used to wear your hat?
And look where they're sitting.
You're joking, right? You guys just walked through the door.
Maybe we didn't make it clear enough.
Yeah.
This couch belongs to us.
Alright, I'll tell you what, you call the couch and then, and then we'll call the couch, and we'll see who it comes to.
You know what I keep wondering? Why you two are still sitting here.
Alright, that's it. I've had enough of this, alright. Gunther, these guys are trying to take our seat.
Fellas, these guys were here first.
Oh, sorry, I didn't realize.
Sorry.
There you go.
Thank you Gunther. We didn't want to have to go and do that.
He told on us?
You told on us?
Well pal, you didn't give me much of a choice.

utterances.transcript: Don't play with his things.
I know.
Alright, let's take this outside.

The guy that's about to kick your ass talks like that.
You had to ask.
Yeah.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah. [the bullies grab the back of the couch that Ross and Chandler are sitting in and tip back]

utterances.transcript: Ok, ok look, see, the thing is we're, we're not gonna fight you guys.
Well then here's the deal, you won't have to so long as never ever show your faces in this coffee house ever again.
I think you played the Gunther card too soon.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Joey is eating breakfast, Rachel has just gotten up, and Monica is on the phone.]

utterances.transcript: I wanna buy 5 shares of SGJ and I wanna buy them now. C'mon time is money my friend. Thank you. Wooo.
Time is money my friend?
Yeah, you missed, 'Takes money to make money,' and uh, 'Don't make me come down there and kick your wall street butt.'
Hey, I made $17 before breakfast, what have you done?
Well uh, I had breakfast here so technically I saved $3.50.
How did you make $17.
Well, my financially challenged friends, I split my money and I bought some shares of CHP and ZXY.
How come those?
Well, CHP because I used to have a crush on Eric Estrada. And ZXY becuase I think it sounds zexy.
What happened to uh, MEG.?
MEG was good for me but I dumped her. Ya know, my motto is get out before they go down.
That is so not my motto.
Hey.
utterances.transcript_with_note: [enters] Hey.

utterances.transcript: Hey Phoebs. Oh hey, how's the dog?
Ok, I talked to the vet, people are so nice upstate. Anyway, he said that the little fella's gonna be ok and I can pick him up tomorrow.
Good.
Oh, thank God.
Yeah, but he did have to have a bunch of stitches and he said that only once in a blue moon does a dog's ear grow back so...still hoping.
Ok, so Phoebe, now are you gonna call your dad and let him know that his dog is ok?
I, I don't wanna meet my father over the phone. What am I gonna say, like 'Hi, I'm Phoebe, the daughter you abandoned. Oh, by the way, I broke your dog.'
Hey Phoebs, if you want, I'll do it.
Ok. Listen, just don't say anything about me, ok.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Ok. Listen, just don't say anything about me, ok. [goes over and grabs the phone that's sitting by Monica]

utterances.transcript: DON'T...be too long with the phone.
She'll be a much better friend when the market closes.
It's a woman.
utterances.transcript_with_note: [dials the phone] It's a woman.

utterances.transcript: So talk to her.
Uhh, hello Miss Buffay. I know where your dog is. I want you to know that he'll be returned to you, almost as good as new, within, within 24 hours. Uh, goodbye.
utterances.transcript_with_note: [in a fake voice] Uhh, hello Miss Buffay. I know where your dog is. I want you to know that he'll be returned to you, almost as good as new, within, within 24 hours. Uh, goodbye. [hangs up]

utterances.transcript: Why the voice.
Hard to say.
utterances.transcript_with_note: [in the voice] Hard to say.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's apartment. Ross is sitting at the bar, Chandler serves up two mugs of hot water.]

utterances.transcript: Your cappucino sir.
Thank you.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Thank you. [they both pour in packets of cappucino mix]

utterances.transcript: Ya know I think this is much better than the coffee house.
Absolutely.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Absolutely. [they both stir thier coffee and proceed to stare into the mugs]

utterances.transcript: How come it's not mixing with the water?
Well the package says you have to uh, constantly keep it moving. Stir and drink, stir and drink, never let it settle.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Well the package says you have to uh, constantly keep it moving. Stir and drink, stir and drink, never let it settle. [they both try to drink while continuously stirring]

utterances.transcript: Hey, this is ridiculous. I'll tell you what. After I get back from my neice's christening, I'll go down to the coffee house with you and we'll all have a nice cup of coffee alright. No problem, Joey's there.
utterances.transcript_with_note: [walks out of his room] Hey, this is ridiculous. I'll tell you what. After I get back from my neice's christening, I'll go down to the coffee house with you and we'll all have a nice cup of coffee alright. No problem, Joey's there.

utterances.transcript: Ok.
No.
No?

No. Man I don't wanna have to have Joey with me every time I wanna descent cup of coffee. Ya know, and I don't wanna spend the rest of my life drinking cappucino with a 'K'. I say you and I go back down there and stand up to those guys.
Alright, hang on a second there Custer.
Yeah really, Ross, have you ever been beaten up before?
Yeah, sure.
By someone besides Monica?
No. So what. So what if we get beaten up, maybe that's just something every man has to go through once in his life. Ya know, like a, like a right of passage or somethin'.
Well, couldn't we just lose our virginities again? Ya know, because I think actually mine's growing back.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Phoebe's dad's house. Phoebe is returning the dog who is bandaged up and has a plastic cone around it's neck.]

utterances.transcript: Hi.
Schnoodle. Oh my God, what the hell happened to my dog?
It was an accident, and, and the woman who did this would never ever hurt a dog on purpose. She's a vegetarian.
What are these, stitches?
Yeah, eight of them. That's 56 to him. You know also, if, if it's raining, you can't let him look up too long 'cause that cone'll fill up really really fast.
Yeah well, thanks for bringing back what's left of him.
Sure, oh, is, is Frank home.
How do you know Frank?
Just from a, from a long time ago. Is he here?
Yeah. Frank.
Yeah. What?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah. What? [a young guy comes around the corner]

utterances.transcript: Oh, ok, um, I mean Frank senior.
He went out for groceries.
Ok so will he be back soon?
Well he left four years ago so we're expecting him back any minute now.
Alright, I'm, I'm gonna go. I'm sorry about the dog, everything. I'm sorry.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Alright, I'm, I'm gonna go. I'm sorry about the dog, everything. I'm sorry. [she turns to leave, Frank follows]

utterances.transcript: Hey lady. Hey wait up. How do you know my dad?
Um well I don't really. Just genetically. He's kinda my dad too.
Heavy.
Yeah. So um, did he ever talk about me, Phoebe?
No but he didn't really talk about anything.
Oh.
Except stilts.
Stilts?

Yeah, he loved stilts. One time I was upstairs, I was stealing cigarettes out of my mom's purse, and uh, all of a sudden I look over and there's my dad's head bobbing past the window. He just had this big smile on his face and he was waving 'cause he was always happiest when he was on his stilts.
Wow.
Yeah.
I don't know what to do with that.
Me neither. So you're like my big sister.
Yeah.
This is huge, you can buy me beer.
I'm not gonna. But you know what's cool though? Ok, if you had a friend named Pete, then I could say, 'Oh yeah, I know Pete, he's friends with my brother.'
I gotta friend named Mark.
That'll work too.
Cool, alright. So maybe, ya know, I could give you a call sometime, we could talk or somethin'.
Yeah, that'd be ok.
Alright.
Ok, I'm in the book.
Ok, yeah.
Alright. So um, stilts huh?
Yeah hey, you know if you want I can take you around back and show you where he hit his head on the rain gutter.
Ok.

utterances.transcript: Well we did it, we're here. We are standing our ground. How long does a cup of coffee take?
Would you come on! Come on! Thank you.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Would you come on! Come on! [waitress brings their coffee] Thank you. [They rush to put the cream and sugar in their cups and gulp down a few drinks]

utterances.transcript: Ah, there we go.
I think we proved our point.
You burn your mouth?
Cannot feel my tounge.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Cannot feel my tounge. [They leave. As they're walking out, the bullies are walking in.]

utterances.transcript: Bullies, big bullies.
Oh, look who's here, it's the weenies.
Did we not make ourselves clear the other day.
Yes, and that's why we're here.
Yes, we're standing out ground...apparently.
Let's do this alright.
Woah, ho-ho, whad'ya got there, a weapon?
It's a nice watch, I don't wanna break it on your ribs.
Alright, let's do this.
Alright.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Alright. [they all put up their fists and prepare to fight]

utterances.transcript: Question. If I don't care about my watch, can I use it as a weapon?
Whad'ya mean?
Well, it's sharp, it's metal, I think I can do some, you know, serious damage with it.
No, you can't use your watch.
Ok.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Ok. [reaches in his pocket]

utterances.transcript: Or your keys.
Ok.
Look, here's what we'll do. We'll put all keys and watches in the hat over there. Alright. Alright, c'mon man, let's do this.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Look, here's what we'll do. We'll put all keys and watches in the hat over there. Alright. [they all put their keys and watches in the hat and put it on a mail box] Alright, c'mon man, let's do this. [they all jump in the street and prepare to fight]

utterances.transcript: Before I forget, are we hitting faces?
Of course we're hitting faces, why wouldn't you hit faces?
Well because I have to work on Monday, I have a big presentation.
Actually, you know, uh, I gotta show this apartment tomorrow and uh, you know, this no faces thing might not be a bad idea.
Ok, nothing from the neck up. Or the waist down. Dana's ovulating.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Ok, nothing from the neck up. [everyone gets ready for the fight] Or the waist down. Dana's ovulating.

utterances.transcript: Oh really, you guys tryin' again?
Yeah.
Ok, so let me just get this straight. So we're uh, strictly talking about the middle?
C'MON!
Hey, hey, woah, you want some of this, huh? You want a piece of this, huh? I'm standin here, huh.
Hey, hey, those guys are takin our stuff!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Hey, hey, those guys are takin our stuff! [some guy runs off with the hat]

utterances.transcript: Hey.
Hey.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Hey. [they all run off after the guy]

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Central Perk. The four guys are returning after getting the hat back.]

utterances.transcript: God, that was, that was amazing, that was incredible. You guys, you guys kicked butt.
Us, what about you guys? Man you really, bing, gave it to old Mr. Clean back there. He was a big guy.
Yeah he was wasn't he.
Yeah, I wouldn't know having missed everything.
Don't do that to yourself. Any one of us could have tripped over that little girls jump-rope.
So, listen guys, are we uh, are we ok here?
We're ok.
Alright.
Ok so, can I have my hat back?
No.
Huh.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Huh. [reaches over and grabs the hat and bolts for the door but slips and falls behind the couch]

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: The 50's theme cafe. Monica is working the grill, the rest are at a table.]

utterances.transcript: Look at her.
Hi Monica.
He-he-he, how's it goin'?
Hey nice boobs.
Guys guys, check this out.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Guys guys, check this out. [Chandler puts a coin in the mini jukebox at the table. YMCA starts playing and Monica and the rest of the staff have to get on the counter and start singing along and dancing. After a couple of couruses, Chandler pulls out a handful of coins and drops them on the table.]

utterances.transcript: Excellent.
